speaker: Patient
text: So, um, I was wondering if it's okay to take the metformin with my meals, or should I be doing it, like, before I eat?

speaker: Clinician
text: It's actually best to take it with your meals. It can help reduce any stomach upset, which is a common side effect. Have you been experiencing any of that?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, a little bit, especially when I, uh, forget and take it on an empty stomach. It's not fun.

speaker: Clinician
text: I can imagine. And, uh, how's it been going with the twice-daily schedule? Are you managing to keep up with it despite your busy days?

speaker: Patient
text: It's been a bit tricky, honestly. Some days I just, um, completely forget the evening dose when I'm caught up with assignments.

speaker: Clinician
text: That's understandable. Maybe setting a reminder on your phone could help? Or, uh, tying it to a routine, like brushing your teeth?

speaker: Patient
text: That's a good idea. I think I could try the reminder. I just don't want to, you know, mess up the treatment.
